website_summaries.verdict: Olympus didn't add much to the Tough TG-4 camera aside from Raw shooting support, but it's as fine a rugged compact as its predecessor.
pros: Protected against freezing, dust, drops, and crushing
Works with conversion lenses and macro light accessories

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Olympus Tough, which should tell you about my commitment to the brand. I like the TG-4 camera, and I am glad that I purchased it. The setup could be a little simpler. After one weekend on the Suwannee River, I lightly scratched the viewer screen, so I highly recommend that you order glass screen protectors before use. The battery charging access door came open while on the river which could have been a disaster, but no problem. It could have been user error, so I will check very carefully to see that the doors are double latched before each use. The camera meets all of my expectations otherwise. It takes great photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey K. White

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this little, lightweight, underwater camera. It takes great pictures outside above water, as well as underwater. The picture quality is not as good inside as I would like inside, but I've used it mostly on a boat or around the pool and have gotten great results. I have a larger DSLR camera for other shots. The video quality is great, also. Lots of different settings for every photo op.
customer_reviews.author: J. Claxton

customer_reviews.title: is affordable & easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding point & shoot camera. It's as tough as it's name, has wifi, gps shoots video, is affordable & easy to use. Only downside is a proprietary USB charging cable that is only a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, BUT
customer_reviews.text: Great, versatile camera when it works BUT seems to have water issues even though it is supposed to be waterproof. Lens fogs up. 2nd time same problem has occcurred with two different Olympus TG-4s. Perhaps there's a minor design flaw?
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Loeb

customer_reviews.title: OK pictures but terrible for video!
customer_reviews.text: Camera take OK pictures, but video quality is really sub par for a camera of this day and age.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck F.

customer_reviews.title: Overall good travel and snapshot camera. Glad to have it.
customer_reviews.text: Performed well on a recent lengthy trip. Written instructions to keep with the camera during use instead of a download to a computer would be good. Some kind of lens protection is desirable. No worries about getting it wet. Dropped it twice, with some marring of the finish and a crack in the viewing screen.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very versitile
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera on our vacation in Bermuda and loved how versitile it is. Gray for ocean & snorkeling pictures, but it also took great pictures of the kids playing outside. It's definitely our go-to camera that we leave in the diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just got it had an older model that was great, hope this is as good or better!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Prelle

customer_reviews.title: a camera for all
customer_reviews.text: great camera, great macro, very resistant to falls, excellent colors, you can't get any better for that price
customer_reviews.author: Ana Cabo Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Night photos could be better, but it's a totally solid camera.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Houston

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product but auto focus is slow and I have many blurred shots.
customer_reviews.author: James Luttrall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera !!!
customer_reviews.text: After my semi professional camera D200 Nikon this is the best camera I gotten
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: worked great for a week long boating trip
customer_reviews.text: worked great for a week long boating trip. Rained almost the whole time, and it held up. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L Fimmen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Transaction! Great Product! Exactly as Promised! Hope to do business again!
customer_reviews.author: shortmatt

customer_reviews.title: nice camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It was what l expected. The on and off button is not easy to get to.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great camera, but the battery dies within hours of ...
customer_reviews.text: Would be a great camera, but the battery dies within hours of just being inside the camera unused. Absolutely NOT functional, Olympus should be ashamed to bring a product like this to market, doesn't it have a testing team? This same complaint is on almost every review. $300 thrown out the window. I would have returned it, but I was already in another country on a long vacation... which would have been even nicer HAVING A CAMERA THAT WORKED.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Talon

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: My camera got stuck. The LED blinks intermittently but the camera does not work. I tried replacing the battery and I also let the batteries run out completely, but it does not work either. I took my camera to an authorized service workshop and the answer they gave me is that the cost of the repair ... is almost equal to the cost of the new camera. Being my second own Olympus camera that result damaged, I made the decision to move to the Nikon brand. I hope to have better luck
customer_reviews.author: Freddy

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a camera. Great for Sportsman.
customer_reviews.text: It took me awhile, But I love this camera. I have used it in some of the harshest conditions in the Yukon and Africa. It has produced some of the best pictures I could have ever hoped for. Battery life is great. Many features. Takes a little while to learn it. Once I did I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Txlongbeard

customer_reviews.title: Image issues when zoomed
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this camera for a year- I purchased it while on vacation through Amazon and had high hopes. As other reviewers have stated, there is an issue with the optics when zoomed in. You end up with a purple smudge in the center of all your photos. The more you zoom, the worse it is. I sent the camera back to Olympus and paid to have the issue "fixed" but there is no change to the image quality. If you don't zoom too much, I imagine you won't have too much of a problem but this should not happen on a $300+ camera.
customer_reviews.author: Glen R

product_meta.title: Olympus TG-4 16 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Black) - International Version
feature_bullets: 4X wide-angle optical zoom with fast f2.0 high speed lens
Waterproof to depths of 50 feet, Freeze proof to 14 degrees F, Shockproof to 7 feet, Crushproof to 220 lb.
RAW capture, Live Composite, Underwater modes with Underwater HDR

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars485 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
